message.content: {"id": "37021", "title": "Bug 37021 - Source path is wrong in declare warning on binary files", "description": "Bug 37021 - Source path is wrong in declare warning on binary files [java|aj]. To reproduce the issue, please refer to the code in tests/new/binaryWarnings/ directory. It's important to note that these tests may produce false positives due to filename checking not being enabled in harness verification of messages. It seems that AJDT omits the filename if it doesn't make sense to AJDT. ", "OB": "The sourcepath in declare warning messages for .class files from injars is displayed in the form 'app.Main.class' instead of 'app/Main.class'.", "EB": "", "SR": "Update the declare warning messages to display the correct sourcepath in the form 'app/Main.class' when targeting .class files from injars."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '37021', 'title': 'Bug 37021source path wrong in declare warning on binary files', 'description': 'Bug 37021source path wrong in declare warning on binary files [java|aj]".See tests/new/binaryWarnings/.. for code to run to see the problem.Limitations of the tests: These tests return false positives when detecting this error because filenamechecking is not enabled in harness verification of messages. (I saw it in AJDT, so perhaps if the filename makes nosense to AJDT, AJDT simply omits it.) ', 'OB': '', 'EB': '', 'SR': 'In declare warning messages when targeting .class files from injars, the sourcepath is listed in the form "app.Main.class" rather than "app/Main. '}
